I had the same issue. Didn't bother since it was a warning. TuriCreate worked fine. Followed the instructions at <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40845304/runtimewarning-numpy-dtype-size-changed-may-indicate-binary-incompatibility>https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40845304/runtimewarning-numpy-dtype-size-changed-may-indicate-binary-incompatibility</denchmark-link>
To suppress warnings (to make the notebook look better :-)) use <denchmark-code>import warnings warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", message="numpy.dtype size changed") warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", message="numpy.ufunc size changed") </denchmark-code>
One of the suggested method was to install using apt install. I haven't tried this. <denchmark-code>pip uninstall -y numpy scipy pandas scikit-learn sudo apt update sudo apt install python3-numpy python3-scipy python3-pandas python3-sklearn </denchmark-code>

Looks like this is actually a numpy bug. Introduced in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/numpy/numpy/commit/cf46d8cd2aa809be44b684ba234880e0aa4befe9#diff-718b683f089ce8e09ffb9aa7b48bc764>numpy/numpy@cf46d8c#diff-718b683f089ce8e09ffb9aa7b48bc764</denchmark-link> (which shipped in 1.15.0). Fixed in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/numpy/numpy/commit/15b7ecdacdb37b6334e9c0312115ad0fabefb676#diff-718b683f089ce8e09ffb9aa7b48bc764>numpy/numpy@15b7ecd#diff-718b683f089ce8e09ffb9aa7b48bc764</denchmark-link> (which went into numpy master 5 days after 1.15.0 shipped). Closing as a Won't Fix on our end, since future numpy versions won't be affected and this was a temporary bug in a single numpy version. Workaround: downgrade numpy from 1.15.0 to any prior recent version, or wait for a new version that contains the fix and then upgrade.
